title: Air temperature
desc: Air temperature at a vertical reference height

title: Current velocity
description: Current velocity at a reference level

title: dBZ
description: Radar reflectivity

title: Dew point temperature
description: The temperature at which dew forms

title: Forecast horizon
description: Future time span of the forecast

title: Maximum wave height
description: Estimated maximum wave height

title: Mean wave direction
description: The average or representative direction waves are coming from

title: Mean wind velocity
desc: Average Wind velocity at a reference height usually expressed as speed and direction from

title: Model forecast charts
description: Model forecast parameters from the GFS based atmospheric and oceanographic models

title: Peak period
description: The period of waves with most energy in a sea state or wave partition

title: Satellite cloud image
description: Mosaiced infrared and visible cloud top imagery from geostationary satellites.

title: Sea
description: Part of the sea state that is being actively generated by the wind

title: Sea state
description: The complete state of waves

title: Sea surface temperature
description: Temperature of the surface layer of the ocean

title: Significant wave height
description: Significant wave height is the average of the top one-third highest waves

title: Spectral parameters
description: Single numbers describing aspects of the sea state

title: Spectral partition
description: Part of the overall wave spectrum that represents a particular wave train such as sea or swell.

title: Storm surge
description: Change of water level caused by meteorogical phenomena

title: Swell
description: Part of the sea state that has been remotely generated

title: Thunderstorm risk
description: Risk of thunderstorm activity based on atmospheric stability

title: Visibility
description: Horizontal visibility

title: Wave spectrum
description: The wave spectrum quantifies the amount of energy in different wave components in the sea state.
